meanings.sent1: The cake looked even scrummier with the extra frosting on top.
meanings.sent2: The new bakery in town serves scrummier pastries than the old one.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't resist the scrummier cupcakes, so I bought a dozen.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a scrummier melody compared to the others in the choir.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread grew even scrummier as it filled the room.

meanings.sent1: This pie is scrummier than the one we had last week.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream parlor offers scrummier flavors during the summer.
meanings.sent3: The scrummier dessert made everyone at the table smile.
meanings.sent4: The sunset looked even scrummier than the sunrise this morning.
meanings.sent5: The garden smelled scrummier after the rain, enhancing the flowers' scents.

meanings.definition: Having a more delicious taste or flavor
meanings.sent1: The soup tasted scrummier with a pinch of extra seasoning.
meanings.sent2: The chef's special dish was even scrummier than expected.
meanings.sent3: The scrummier cookies disappeared quickly at the party.
meanings.sent4: The scrummier fruits in the basket were ripe and juicy.
meanings.sent5: The chocolate became even scrummier when paired with a glass of milk.
